Fun Facts About Me!

Posted by on June 25, 2023 · 3 mins read

So, for starters I believe that I’m a really outgoing and caring person, I love spending time with my friends and family and I’m a big animal-lover. Enough chit-chatting, let me start with some fun-facts that would describe who I am.

  1. I hate waking up early!
    • For me, waking up early is one of the hardest thing to do. I enjoy sleeping, so when I have to wake up early for classes I have to mentally prepare myself to be able to be concentrated and listen the lecture :D . Also, I study way better at night and actually enjoy finishing my studies after midnight, then sleep at least 9 hours to feel refreshed the next day.
  2. I am a vegetarian.
    • Yes, many people are surprised when I tell them this and I sometimes find it funny when they have questions like: "How do you live without meat?!", or "How do you consume protein?", but I don't mind giving them answers. I got used to the absence of meat in my diet, and I've never craved it. That is one of the main reasons why I stopped eating it. But I have to admit, sometimes being a vegetarian is difficult when going to restaurants, where there aren't many vegetarian options, but I always find a way to manage in those type of situations.
  3. I have a black cat.
    • Many people think that black cats are bad luck, but I strongly disagree. My cat is named Mambo, and he is the sweetest thing in my life. He's a rescue, as my family and I rescued him from being tossed in a garbage container and pasted with glue all over his fur. He was only 2 months old when we rescued him and this year he'll be turning 6! It's crazy how the time flies!
  4. I used to play the violin.
    • When I was in elementary school, I also used to go to a musical school, specifically "DMBUC Ilija Nikolovski-Luj" in Skopje, where I learned how to play the violin. But unfortunately, after finishing elementary and going to high school I stopped playing it regularly, as I didn't have much time to study and spend time playing it.
  5. I always knew that my profession with be something linked with computer science.
    • Ever since I was little, I've loved spending time in front of the computer, regardless of whether it was for educational or entertainment purposes. So, that's when I decided that I wanted to spend my life learning about programming and software engineering. I currently study software engineering at FINKI but I also have interest in data science, so I can't wait to get to the 6th semester, because that's when I'll have a subject about it.
